TopicTitle: Where to start with plugin development

Articles.Content:
OK maybe not the best first post but I have searched the forums and can\'t seem to find any docs on developing plugins.

I use C# at work and have some experience with Unity3D and would like to contribute to the community.

Could someone please give me a nudge in the right direction?
I searched the forum half a week for this, but it\'s pretty easy: Add assembly-csharp.dll from KSP_Data or so and you can look up everything in the object browser.

Great that helps.

Now if I can just resist the urge to play around with this at work.
Still I would like to see some dummy plugin file, or a cheat sheet with some basic functions. Just to get a grip of it.
OH SNAP. Thanks, thats great place to start indeed. (actually i think it should be stickied somewhere)

this link and this thread need to be re-stickied on the plugins section, as the link from the old Plugin Dev forum is no longer working.

just a heads up for a mod
Great questions and great answers! I've wanted to get started with addons as well and this really helps =)
Is there a way to run KSP release version with my own Plugin in a debug mode ? (so i will be able to get brakepoints for debugging (lot easier)). Im using MS Visual Studio 2k10.
